children: A 19-year-old woman with epilepsy and learning disabilities is evaluated for the skin findings
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

The elliptical hypopigmented macule in this image is recognized as the ash-leaf spot associated with tuberous sclerosis, a congenital neurocutaneous syndrome. Tuberous sclerosis complex (TSC) is a genetic disorder with mutations in the tumor-suppressing genes

and resulting tumors in many organs, primarily the brain, eyes, heart, kidney, skin, and lungs. Most patients have cutaneous findings, including hypopigmented macules (ash-leaf spots), angiofibromas, Shagreen patches, and fibrous forehead plaques. Epilepsy is present in most patients with tuberous sclerosis, and cognitive deficits, learning disabilities, and behavioral problems are also common.

objective.__html: Recognize the ash-leaf spot and its association with tuberous sclerosis complex.
